definition: to monopolize/to take on responsibility over everything/to undertake the whole task
surname Bao
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
to monopolize/to seize/to take into one's arms/to embrace/to fasten (with a rope etc)/to take on (responsibility etc)/to canvass
to canvas for lawsuits (idiom); to practice chicanery

sentences.english: In the north, light back to the sea king hanyang, swept all the responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 在朝鮮，光海君回到漢陽，包攬了全部的責任。

sentences.english: He scoured the pots and pans and put away the milk and swept the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 他蒐羅罈罈罐罐和收起的牛奶，幷包攬了廚房。

sentences.english: Jiang Wenli more with Golden Eagle TV Festival The show won three awards.
sentences.chinese: 蔣雯麗更憑藉此劇在金鷹電視節包攬三項大獎。

sentences.english: Leaders from Hyundai Motor Group and Samsung Electronics swept the top 5, JoongAng Ilbo reported.
sentences.chinese: 富豪榜的前5名被三星和現代公司的人士包攬。

sentences.english: Peace-keeping operations can not and will not address all problems.
sentences.chinese: 維和行動不可能包攬一切，也不可能解決所有問題。

sentences.english: Sawa hero is taking the Golden Boot and Golden Globe.
sentences.chinese: 功臣澤穗希則包攬了金靴獎和金球獎。

sentences.english: They scored all 12 of Miami's points in overtime;
sentences.chinese: 他們包攬了加時賽中熱火的全部12分。

sentences.english: Now they are ranked first, second and third worldwide in terms of market capitalisation.
sentences.chinese: 現在它們的市值包攬的世界所有上市公司的前三名。

sentences.english: Of course, these foreign partners will not do all the work.
sentences.chinese: 當然，這些國外合夥人不會包攬所有的工作。

sentences.english: Don't try to run the whole show or do most of the work.
sentences.chinese: 不要試着去操控整個事情或者包攬所有的工作。

sentences.english: In both cases, no one is doing all of the work.
sentences.chinese: 這兩種活動當中沒有人是一人包攬所有工作的。

sentences.english: China expects to make a clean sweep in the Water Cube at home land.
sentences.chinese: 中國跳水隊希望在水立方包攬所有金牌。

definition: grand slam
Golden Globe Award
champion/CL:個|个[ge4]
to win every trick in a card game/grand slam/fig. total success
Ever Victorious Army (1860-1864), Qing dynasty army equipped and trained jointly with Europeans and used esp. against the Taiping rebels
to undertake to do everything by oneself/to run the whole show
special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
singles (in sports)/CL:場|场[chang3]
fame follows merit (idiom)
competition/to compete/to pursue
the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
Four Asian Tigers/East Asian Tigers/Four Little Dragons (East Asian economic powers: Taiwan, South Korea, Singapore and Hong Kong)
to get past the qualifying round/to make it to the finals
trophy cup
Academy Awards/Oscars/CL:屆|届[jie4]
